awd_titl_txt: Numerical Solutions for Aircraft Tracking and Position      Prediction
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this program is to design a computer                      algorithm and prototype implementation to track aircraft in a                   sparse reporting environment.  The probability density function                 of the observed aircraft will be propagated between arrivals of                 new target reports by means of the numerical solution of a                      partial differential equation of evolution of a nonlinear                       stochastic differential equation of aircraft motion.  The                       resulting non-Gaussian density will be combined with new reports                using Bayesian methods to update estimates of aircraft position.                     In order to perform the tracking function in realtime, the                 algorithm will be designed to work in paralled computing                        environment.  When implemented in the multiprocessor environment,               the algorithm will improve the performance of a currently                       operational software system used for aircraft detection and                     tracking.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

inst.inst_name: Daniel H Wagner Associates Inc (Hampton Office)
